subject: p18110020
Impression: AP chest compared to : Small region of opacification in the left mid lung could be atelectasis or early pneumonia. Lungs are otherwise clear. There is no pleural effusion. Heart size is probably top normal, but difficult to assess given severe chest cage deformity by virtue of scoliosis. Right PIC line ends in the mid SVC and a nasogastric tube passes below the diaphragm and out of view. No pneumothorax.
